tweet: Opiniรณn impopular pero Angelina Jolie es un pedazo de basura
article: Angelina Jolie sits at a desk, back straight as a rule and rather regal. Her features are cartoonishly beautiful โ straight black hair, vertiginous cheekbones, huge blue eyes and lips like a plumped red sofa. She is talking on Zoom to four young activists. It is a horribly apt day to be discussing human rights โ the Taliban has just captured Ghazni city on its approach to Kabul, the capital of Afghanistan. If this were a movie, you might suspect Jolie was playing a divine leader addressing the fortunate few. Yet it soon becomes apparent that things arenโt quite as they seem. The actor and film director is the one in awe, not the activists. The young people talk about the work they have done raising awareness of the carnage in Syria, the environmental crisis, trans rights and food poverty. Jolie hangs on their every word. She tells them they have inspired her children who follow their work, warns them against burnout, apologises for the failings of her generation and says how honoured she is to meet them. The next evening it is just Jolie and me Zooming. In the background I can hear kids playing. Our conversation is frequently interrupted by the ferocious roar of her rottweiler Dusty, who appears to believe he is a lion. Itโs been an even more depressing day for human rights โ the Taliban has entered Kabul and toppled the Afghanistan government. Jolie says the only thing giving her hope is the young people we met last night. โThey speak about these issues with more urgency and awareness of what is morally right and decent than any politician, any diplomat, any NGOs Iโve worked with.โ She says she canโt stop thinking about Muhammad Najem, a 19-year-old who literally shouted from the rooftops about the Syrian regimeโs siege of his home village, Eastern Ghouta. After his father was killed four years ago in an airstrike on the mosque where he was praying, Muhammad and his brother would wait for the daily bombing to stop, film the carnage from their roof and document the suffering of survivors. He and his family soon became government targets, and fled to Turkey from where he spoke to us. It wasnโt just his bravery that was notable; it was the warmth of his smile, his zest for life, despite all he has seen. Since we last spoke, Jolie has Zoomed again with Muhammad and a girl who is campaigning against period poverty. โHis relationship to that teenage girl and her activism was more in tune than almost any man Iโve met,โ Jolie says. We agree that cloning Muhammad may be the answer to world peace. โHe is that evolved man!โ Jolie says. Jolie has spent 20 years campaigning for human rights, first as a goodwill ambassador and then special envoy for the UN high commissioner for refugees. She has carried out more than 60 field missions, invariably with notepad and pen in hand, bearing witness to people displaced by war and persecution in countries such as Syria, Sierra Leone, Iraq and Afghanistan. Now Jolie, 46, has written a book with child rights lawyer Geraldine Van Bueren QC and Amnesty International, called Know Your Rights, a guide for young people named after the Clash song whose title is also tattooed on Jolieโs back. The book lays out all the rights children have under the UN convention on the rights of the child, ratified by 196 countries, explains how to claim them and offers advice from young people who have done. Know Your Rights tackles all the big issues in a chatty, accessible way โ from the rights to life, dignity, health, equality and non-discrimination, criminal justice, a safe place, freedom of thought and expression, privacy, peaceful protest, play and education, to the right to protections from harm and armed violence. I ask Jolie why she has written the book. โIโve met too many children who live with the effect of their rights being violated โ displaced people, young rape victims. I couldnโt understand why they were still fighting for basic things that were their rights to begin with. It made me very angry. How are we going to solve anything if weโre not addressing that, right?โ Her explanation is fluent and authoritative โ and not surprising. But the next bit is. โThen I had an experience in the States with my own children and I thought... well, human rights, childrenโs rights.โ Suddenly the fluency is gone. Her language becomes disjointed and elliptical. โI remembered the rights of the child, and I took them out and looked at them and thought: well, these are for when youโre in a situation and you want to make sure there is support for the children in your life.โ She apologises, and says she canโt be more direct. โThen I found out the US hadnโt ratified the rights of the child. One of the ways it affects children is their voice in court โ a child in Europe would have a better chance of having a voice in court than a child in California. That said a lot to me about this country.โ What happened that made her fear for her childrenโs rights. โI... Iโm still in my own legal situation,โ she stammers. โI canโt speak about that.โ Look, I say, there has been so much nonsense written about you over the years, itโs impossible to distinguish between truth and fiction โ you have to help me understand what you are alluding to. Are you talking about your divorce from Brad Pitt and the allegations you have made against him of domestic abuse? She tells me she is sworn to silence. Well, nod if youโre talking about the divorce and allegations. She nods. And did she fear for the safety of her children? This time she answers. โYes, for my family. My whole family.โ It would be amazing, I say, to spend your life on the world stage, highlighting the abuse of childrenโs rights, and then discover that these same rights may have been compromised so close to home. โOften you cannot recognise something in a personal way, especially if your focus is on the greatest global injustices, because everything else seems smaller. Itโs so hard. Iโd like to be able to have this discussion and itโs so important...โ She makes a couple of efforts to complete her sentence, gives up and starts again. And now the fluency returns. โIโm not the kind of person who makes decisions like the decisions I had to make lightly. It took a lot for me to be in a position where I felt I had to separate from the father of my children.โ Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt were Hollywoodโs golden couple; so famous that they had a portmanteau moniker, Brangelina. And Brangelina was, aptly, the ultimate celebrity brand. Both are Oscar winners, among the highest paid stars in the film business (Pitt is said to be worth $300m, Jolie $150m), mainstream draws and indie icons, and of course utterly gorgeous (Pitt was twice voted the sexiest man alive by People magazine, while Jolie was named sexiest woman alive by Esquire magazine in 2004). But Brangelina also became a byword for celebrity altrusim and consciousness-raising. Pitt accompanied Jolie on many of her UNHCR trips, they opened schools in war-torn countries, and three of their six children were adopted from countries brutalised by conflict and poverty โ 20-year-old Maddox is Cambodian, 17-year-old Pax is Vietnamese and 16-year-old Zahara is Ethiopian. They even managed to manipulate the media to their own ends. Faced with the inevitability of being papped when their daughter Shiloh was born in 2006, Jolie and Pitt auctioned off the photoshoot to People magazine in the US and Hello! in Britain for $7.6m. Two years later, when twins Knox and Vivienne arrived, they sold the shoot to the same magazines for an estimated $14m, making them the most expensive celebrity photos in history. On both occasions, the proceeds went to the Jolie-Pitt Foundation to fund humanitarian projects. As a couple, they seemed too good (or at least too successful) to be true. And so it proved. In September 2016, Jolie filed for divorce from Pitt, which was finalised in 2019. But they are still locked in a bitter custody battle, after she alleged domestic violence against him. In November 2016, the FBI announced no charges would be brought against Pitt, and cleared him of any wrongdoing, following an incident a couple of months earlier on their private plane in which it was alleged that a drunk Pitt was abusive with Maddox, then 15. Five days after the incident, Jolie filed for divorce, citing irreconcilable differences and stating that her decision to end the marriage โwas made for the health of the familyโ. Pitt admitted he had an alcohol problem (he attended Alcoholics Anonymous after their separation) and that he had yelled at one of his children, but has always denied being physically abusive to them. Jolie refuses to say anything about the incident due to court proceedings. Pittโs lawyers declined to comment when invited to do so by the Guardian. Today Jolie is at home in Los Feliz, a residential neighbourhood near the Hollywood Hills. She bought the mansion, which cost a reputed $25m and used to be home to the film-maker Cecil B DeMille, to make it easier for the children to visit Pitt after the separation. For most of the past five years she has had custody, while he has had visitation rights. Although it has frequently been reported that the issues leading to the current court proceedings were about Jolie fighting for sole custody, in fact they were about how a healthy joint custody relationship could be achieved. I can hear a couple of the children playing in the background, while Dusty continues to make regular contributions to the conversation. โWhat I know is when a child has been harmed, physically, emotionally, or witnessed the harm of somebody they love or care for, it can cause damage to that child. One of the reasons children need to have these rights is because without them they are vulnerable to living unsafe, unhealthy lives.โ She may be talking about children in general, but it sounds personal. In the custody battle, much of the world appears to have taken sides. Some family law attorneys have criticised Jolie for wanting her children to testify against their father, while Jolie suggests it would be a betrayal of their rights for her to let it rest. Meanwhile, Jolieโs lawyers have said three of the children have asked to give their testimony. I ask Jolie when she first became aware of human rights and she starts to talk about her motherโs values. โShe didnโt come at them as if it was a job or a calling, she was just kind. She was a decent human being who was bothered when she saw people mistreated. It was really that simple.โ Jolieโs mother, Marcheline Bertrand, who died of ovarian cancer in 2007, aged 56, trained as an actor, hung out with Jim Morrison when she was young, and by the end of her life was the partner of Native American activist and poet John Trudell. Jolieโs father, the actor Jon Voight, was Oscar-nominated for Midnight Cowboy (1969) and won best actor for Coming Home in 1979, but was a less impressive parent in Jolieโs eyes. She says her mother sacrificed her career to bring up her two children (Jolie has an older brother, James Haven), largely as a single parent. โMy mom married at 21, and by the time she was 25 she was divorced with two little kids. She couldnโt be the artist she wanted to be, but she raised her children with art and creativity. Even if it was a birthday party, she found a way to put those talents to use.โ She says what she loved about her mother is that she embraced difference and was open to all experiences. โShe didnโt try to make me a mould of her. We were very different as women.โ In what way? โShe would always want me to sit next to the stranger on the plane because she was shy, right? While I loved her softness, she loved my strength. She was very still, and Iโm constantly in motion. I was very sexual, and she was much more of a lady. But she saw my true self and encouraged it fully, and she taught me to do that for my own children. My children are all very different from each other.โ Her mother always told Jolie to be useful in life, but as a teenager, she says, she didnโt know what she meant. She experimented with drugs, including heroin, drank excessively and cut herself in an attempt to overcome an overwhelming sense of emptiness. She had her first live-in lover at 14. Her mother suggested her boyfriend move in to stop her leaving home and going further off the rails. Jolie was anti-establishment, and outspoken, but she was also a mess. โIt took me a good while to feel I could be of use to anyone because I felt for a long time that I was a little crazy, that I was a little unhinged, and not settled. If you would have asked me as a teenager if I could have been anybodyโs mom, or of any use to the UN or write a book, I would have said absolutely not.โ With the benefit of hindsight, does she still feel she was unhinged? โMaybe thatโs whatโs so helpful about meeting with all these young people. They are reminding me that back at the time I felt I was a bit crazy for challenging a system, or being angry about certain things I was witnessing, I wasnโt wrong. To be around all these young people who have, for good reason, a sense of fight and rebellion and willingness to get in there and bleed if necessary for something they know is wrong โ it reminds me of who I was when I was younger. And it reminds me that it isnโt something bad.โ Back then, Jolie would also bleed for a cause, even if she wasnโt sure what the cause was. When she married the actor Jonny Lee Miller at the age of 20, she wore a T-shirt with his name inscribed on it in her blood. When she was with her second husband, Billy Bob Thornton, they wore vials of each otherโs blood around their necks. She appeared on TV shows, doing outrageous tricks with butterfly knives. It was hard to work out if she was a raging self-publicist, dangerous, or both. Looking at Jolie today, itโs hard to connect the urbane woman in the Saint Laurent suits with the punk in the leather jacket. But Jolie says they are very much the same person; she just didnโt know how to focus her energy. โI was rudderless. I was seeking freedom, truth, feeling. I wanted to feel deeply and experience deeply.โ She laughs. โListen, I grew up in Hollywood. This town is disturbing. I was hurt from a lot of different things in life.โ What hurt so much when she was young? Again, she returns to her mother. โMy mom was in a lot of pain. My father had an affair, and then there were a lot of challenges with child support and alimony. Then she lost her parents, and was quite broken, so I was determined to help her when I was young.โ She was told she could be an actor or a model โas if itโs this great thingโ, but now sheโs not so sure. She suggests that had she been a boy, other choices would have been offered. โNobody tells you you can be a director or a lawyer. So I was pushed down a path, and I wanted to be successful to financially help her, and to be able to make more choices in her life and my life.โ She says her mother was not only denied a career, but also a voice. โI realised when I was young, the person who had a public voice had more power than the very kind, decent woman at home doing all the right things and making all the sacrifices.โ She is referring to her father, an outspoken Trump supporter who said that the campaign to get the US election result overturned was โthe greatest fight since the civil war โ the battle of righteousness versus Satanโ, and from whom she has often been estranged. Jolie says she was determined that she would not be silenced as her mother had been. โI donโt think I came into this business because I wanted to be an actor. I came into it because thatโs where you could have a voice. When you have somebody who controls the finances and controls the family narrative because they are public, youโre all under that person.โ At the age of seven, Jolie made her film debut in Hal Ashbyโs Lookinโ To Get Out, playing the daughter of Voightโs character. By 16, she was modelling swimwear, and at 20 she was starring in Hackers alongside future husband Jonny Lee Miller. In 2000, at the age of 24, she won the best supporting actress Oscar for her visceral portrait of a psychiatric patient in Girl, Interrupted. In 2013, she earned an estimated $33m, mainly from her contract with Louis Vuitton and her appearance as the eponymous witch in Maleficent. Her choice of acting roles suggests she acts primarily for the money โ alongside the odd quality film (she was great as Mariane Pearl, the wife of Wall Street Journal reporter Daniel Pearl in A Mighty Heart, despite the controversy of a white woman playing a mixed-race character), there have been any number of stinkers. Before separating from Pitt, she was establishing herself as a film-maker. First They Killed My Father, the last film she made as a director (released in 2017), is a haunting portrait of life under the Khmer Rouge, in which she coaxed exceptional, understated performances from her actors โ particularly the children. Since then, her career has taken a back seat as she has dedicated herself to being pretty much a full-time mother. Does she feel her rights have always been respected? โHmm. A good therapy question.โ She pauses. โI think my mother did a lot to ensure my rights and empower me. But you know, I started working really young to help her pay bills and stuff. And I wasnโt aware of how I deserved to be treated as a young girl and a human being. I didnโt feel I was born with these rights and protections. I felt that these were things you had to demand or fight for, and sometimes be seen as difficult when you do.โ Is she seen as difficult? โI will certainly challenge whoeverโs in my way to get to whatever it is I think needs to be done.โ When was the first time she felt sufficiently disrespected in the industry to tell somebody to fuck off? โErmโฆ well, no surprise, Harvey Weinstein. I worked with him when I was young.โ She was 21 when she made the Miramax film Playing By Heart, executive produced by the infamous sexual predator and convicted rapist. She says women often play down an assault if they manage to escape โ as she did at the time. โIf you get yourself out of the room, you think he attempted but didnโt, right? The truth is that the attempt and the experience of the attempt is an assault.โ What happened? โI really donโt want to derail the book into stories about Harvey.โ But that was an abuse of rights? โIt was. It was beyond a pass, it was something I had to escape. I stayed away and warned people about him. I remember telling Jonny, my first husband, who was great about it, to spread the word to other guys โ donโt let girls go alone with him. I was asked to do The Aviator, but I said no because he was involved. I never associated or worked with him again. It was hard for me when Brad did.โ In 2009, Pitt starred in Quentin Tarantinoโs Inglourious Basterds, co-produced by the Weinstein Company. In 2012, she says Pitt approached Weinstein to work as a producer for the noir thriller Killing Them Softly, which the Weinstein Company later distributed. In doing so, Jolie felt he was minimising the sexual assault she had endured. โWe fought about it. Of course it hurt,โ Jolie says about Pitt being happy to work with Weinstein, despite knowing he had assaulted her. She avoided attending promotional events for the film. Weinstein, who is currently serving a 23-year jail sentence for rape and sexual assault, denies Jolieโs allegation. Jolie is drinking from a bottle as she talks. What is it? โItโs kombucha. Itโs not alcohol โ not yet anyway!โ She giggles and takes another swig. I ask if her children are interested in activism. She tells me that theyโre all very different, but itโs hard for them not to be because of the way the family came about. โWithin the understanding that they are family comes a lot of awareness that has to be born of all the years of them growing up together, learning from each other, discussing adoption, race and family. Having people say: how could you be sisters, youโre not the same colour, when youโre a little kid. Going to each otherโs countries and being the only person of their background in that country and feeling outside, yet itโs your family.โ I ask Jolie if she always wanted to adopt. No, she says: when she was growing up she didnโt want children. โI never wanted to babysit, I never had dolls, so itโs hilarious Iโve ended up with six children.โ What did you have instead of dolls? โI liked to play office. Then in my late teens I became aware of what adoption is, and the idea that there were children around the world who had been orphaned, and it just made sense to me. I never have had this idea of โmy own bloodโ.โ Even though she gave birth to three children fathered by Pitt, genetics has never interested her. โIt was just family born of being together and growing together, right?โ She often concludes a sentence with right โ part question, part declaration. In 2013, Jolie wrote an op-ed in the New York Times revealing that she had had a preventive double mastectomy because she was a carrier of the BRCA1 genetic mutation that had killed her mother and put her at high risk of breast and ovarian cancer. Two years later, she wrote another article announcing she had also had surgery to remove her ovaries and fallopian tubes. It was unheard of to hear a Hollywood A-lister at the peak of her career discussing these issues. But it proved a gamechanger. A year later a UK report found that her decision to go public on the mastectomy led to a doubling in NHS referrals for genetic tests of breast cancer risk. Was going public a form of activism, I ask. Well, she says, she certainly wouldnโt use that word to describe it. In fact, she adds, she rarely uses the word full stop. Was it a way of saying to people: if preventive surgery can make sense for me, it can for you, too? โAs Iโve gone through my life, Iโve never had that confidence that if I do this it will make a difference. I donโt think of myself in that way. Itโs just me thinking: if my mom knew about this and had this surgery and she had read an op-ed like this, she might still be alive. Therefore I really feel I should write this, because maybe somebodyโs mom will read it.โ I tell her I find it fascinating, the binary way in which she is portrayed โ either as a saint or a crazy, an arch manipulator. (It has been suggested that she is fighting for custody of the children simply because she wants to move out of America โ something she denies.) โI think people sometimes just need people to be what they need them to be. What matters to me is that if people think this or that about me, does it affect my ability to work for childrenโs rights? Does it affect my ability to work with Muhammad and help him? If you truly think Iโm crazy, then thatโs a problem, because you may not listen to him as much and may not value me saying how important he is or this book is.โ As she talks, I notice how tired she looks. While refusing to discuss details about her divorce, she has said that the experience has been traumatic and has left her feeling โbrokenโ. What have the past five years taken out of her? There is a long pause. She cups her face in her hands, and looks ready to burst into tears. โI mean, in some ways itโs been the last decade. Thereโs a lot I canโt say,โ she repeats. โI think at the end of the day, even if you and a few people you love are the only people who know the truth of your life, what you fight for, or what you sacrifice, or what youโve suffered, you come to be at peace with that, regardless of everything going on around you.โ Has it proved hard to come out of all this at peace with herself? โIโm not out of it,โ she says, quietly. I suppose what Iโm asking in a clumsy way is: how are you? She looks even more upset. โItโs really hard to answer.โ Another pause. โHow am I? Iโm realising that sometimes you can survive things, but not know how to feel and live in the same way. So itโs more about being open. Iโm really trying to be open as a human being again.โ Discovering that the convention on the rights of the child has not been ratified by the US has given her a sense of purpose: rather than simply fighting for her children, she can see it as a bigger human rights cause. She is trying to put a positive spin on her situation. โIt has been so horrific that I almost have to see it as a godsend to be in a position to be able to fight this system. It doesnโt start with the violation [the plane incident]. Itโs so much more complicated than that.โ She says the lack of ratification has had a significant impact on her battle: โMy 17-year-old, for example, has been denied a voice in court.โ Jolie is complex, and at times contradictory. She tells me she wants to talk about all this; the next minute, she changes her mind. โItโs not that I want to talk about anything really, because I just want my family to heal. And I want everyone to move forward โ all of us, including their dad. I want us to heal and be peaceful. Weโll always be a family.โ Itโs not only Jolie whoโs complex; so is the situation. Itโs hard to see how even she could press ahead with her allegation of domestic violence and achieve a peaceful resolution. When I mention how upset she looks, she admits she has been emotional today, since seeing the Taliban take over Kabul. โThis morning I just had a big cry about Afghanistan. That was the beginning for me, 20 years ago โ those first few trips when you meet people and really connect. You meet little kids, see the promises made, the efforts made, the trust given, see everything, then you track them being put on trucks to be sent back, and you track them back in Kabul, and at school, and you get a sense of the pain and fear and death and the horror and the betrayal and the trauma. Itโs disgusting. It says too much about the world weโre living in today. It says too much about where weโre at.โ But at the same time, it makes her think about Muhammad and the three other activists we met, fighting so fiercely for a better world. It makes her think of all the terrible trade-offs that politicians make that lead to outcomes such as Afghanistan. It makes her think of her young self, refusing to yield to convention, and all those people who have dismissed her as bats in the intervening years for believing that justice and humanity can win the day rather than realpolitik. โNo,โ she says, her self-belief restored, โIโm not crazy.โ Know Your Rights by Angelina Jolie is published by Andersen Press at ยฃ7.99. To support the Guardian and Observer, order your copy at guardianbookshop.com. Delivery charges may apply.

article: Popรผler inanฤฑลฤฑn aksine (mevcut cevaplarฤฑn รงoฤunda yankฤฑlanฤฑyor gibi gรถrรผnรผyor), Clinton'un "ilk siyahi baลkan" lakabฤฑ aลaฤฤฑlayฤฑcฤฑ deฤildi ve ฤฑrkรงฤฑlar tarafฤฑndan yaratฤฑlmamฤฑลtฤฑ. ฤฐlk kez Toni Morrison tarafฤฑndan kullanฤฑlmฤฑลtฤฑr. Ben de siyah olmadฤฑฤฤฑm iรงin, aลaฤฤฑdaki gรถrรผล iรงin dinlemeniz gereken ilk kiลi ben deฤilim, ama sanฤฑrฤฑm birรงok edebiyat eleลtirmeni ve Afro-Amerikan araลtฤฑrmalarฤฑ alanฤฑnda รงalฤฑลan akademisyenler, bugรผn hayatta olan herhangi bir yazarฤฑn onun hakkฤฑnda konuลma yetkisine sahip olup olmadฤฑฤฤฑ konusunda hemfikir olacaktฤฑr. Amerika'daki siyahi deneyimi, Toni Morrison. (Nedenini gรถrmek iรงin En Mavi Gรถz, Sevgili veya Sรผleyman'ฤฑn ลarkฤฑsฤฑ'nฤฑ okuyun.) ฤฐลte 1998'de The Newyorker.com/magazine/1998/10/05/comment-6543 adlฤฑ makalesinde sรถylediฤi ลey: New Yorker: %3E Afrikalฤฑ-Amerikalฤฑ erkek bunu hemen anlamฤฑล gรถrรผnรผyordu. Yฤฑllar รถnce, Whitewater soruลturmasฤฑnฤฑn ortasฤฑnda ilk mฤฑrฤฑltฤฑlar duyuldu: Beyaz tenli olmasฤฑna raฤmen bu bizim ilk siyah Baลkanฤฑmฤฑz. รocuklarฤฑmฤฑzฤฑn yaลamฤฑ boyunca seรงilebilecek herhangi bir gerรงek siyah kiลiden daha siyah. Ne de olsa Clinton, siyahiliฤin neredeyse her tรผrlรผ kinayesini sergiliyor: tek ebeveynli ev, yoksul doฤmuล, iลรงi sฤฑnฤฑfฤฑndan, saksafon รงalan, McDonald's ve abur cubur seven Arkansas'lฤฑ รงocuk. Ve Clinton'ฤฑn atadฤฑฤฤฑ neredeyse tรผm Afrika kรถkenli Amerikalฤฑlar birer birer ortadan kaybolmaya baลladฤฑฤฤฑnda, Baลkan'ฤฑn bedeni, mahremiyeti ve kontrolsรผz cinselliฤi zulmรผn odaฤฤฑ haline geldiฤinde, mecazi olarak ele geรงirilip รผzeri arandฤฑฤฤฑnda, kim buna karลฤฑ รงฤฑkabilirdi? Nereden bahsettiklerini bilen bu siyah adamlar? Mesaj aรงฤฑktฤฑ: โNe kadar akฤฑllฤฑ olursan ol, ne kadar รงalฤฑลฤฑrsan รงalฤฑล, bizim iรงin ne kadar para kazanฤฑrsan kazan, seni bir ลekilde, bizim iznimizle de olsa, elde ettiฤin yere koyacaฤฤฑz veya bulunduฤun yerden รงฤฑkaracaฤฤฑz. . ฤฐลinizden kovulacaksฤฑnฤฑz, utanรง iรงinde bir kenara gรถnderileceksiniz ve kim bilir? belki de cezaya รงarptฤฑrฤฑlฤฑp hapse atฤฑlacaksฤฑnฤฑz. Kฤฑsacasฤฑ bizim sรถylediฤimizi yapmazsanฤฑz (yani bir an รถnce asimile olmazsanฤฑz) kรผfรผrleriniz bize aittir.โ Kฤฑsmen "ilk siyahi baลkan", Bill Clinton'un beyaz tenli olmasฤฑna raฤmen Amerika'daki birรงok siyah erkeฤinkine benzer bir hayat yaลadฤฑฤฤฑ gerรงeฤini yansฤฑtฤฑyor. Ancak bu aynฤฑ zamanda bรผyรผk รถlรงรผde baลarฤฑlฤฑ bir beyaz adam olarak baลarฤฑlฤฑ siyah erkeklerin karลฤฑlaลtฤฑฤฤฑna benzer bir ortamla karลฤฑ karลฤฑya olduฤu gerรงeฤini de yansฤฑtan bir isim; burada onlarฤฑn baลarฤฑlarฤฑnฤฑ kรผรงรผk dรผลรผren ve baลarฤฑlarฤฑndan herhangi birine tutunan sistemik bir รงevresel eฤilim var. baลarฤฑsฤฑzlฤฑklar ne kadar kรผรงรผk olursa olsun. Yoksulluktan ya da sorunlu ailelerden รงฤฑkan siyah erkekler sรถz konusu olduฤunda, bu, siyah erkeklere her zaman bir ลekilde ลรผphelenmeye ya da incelenmeye daha deฤermiล gibi davranan iลverenler ya da iล dรผnyasฤฑ ya da kolluk kuvvetleri sistemidir; Clinton'un durumunda, Kongre sistemi ve (รถzellikle) basฤฑn, algฤฑlanan kiลisel baลarฤฑsฤฑzlฤฑklarฤฑ nedeniyle daha รถnceki hiรงbir baลkanฤฑn yapmadฤฑฤฤฑ ลekilde onun peลini bฤฑrakmadฤฑ. Kฤฑsacasฤฑ bu, Hillary Clinton'un o yฤฑlฤฑn baลlarฤฑnda The Today Show'da yaptฤฑฤฤฑ, artฤฑk meลhur olan yoruma yapฤฑlan ฤฑrksal bir benzetmedir: %3E Onu bulmaya, onun hakkฤฑnda yazmaya ve aรงฤฑklamaya istekli herkes iรงin buradaki harika hikaye, bu geniล saฤcฤฑdฤฑr. Baลkanlฤฑฤa adaylฤฑฤฤฑnฤฑ aรงฤฑkladฤฑฤฤฑ gรผnden bu yana kocama karลฤฑ komplo kuran bir komplo. Bill Clinton'ฤฑn her tรผrden insanla kolay bir dostluฤu vardฤฑ ve รถzellikle siyahlara karลฤฑ sempatik davranฤฑyordu. Gรผney'de fakir bir ลekilde bรผyรผdรผ ve รงoฤu beyazฤฑn yapmadฤฑฤฤฑ bir ลekilde siyahlarla temasฤฑ vardฤฑ, bu da ona siyah seรงmenlerin yanฤฑnda beyaz adaylarฤฑn genellikle eลleลtiremeyeceฤi bir rahatlฤฑk saฤladฤฑ. ฤฐlk kampanyasฤฑ sฤฑrasฤฑnda, Arkansas รniversitesi'ndeki ilk gรผnรผnde doฤrudan kafeteryadaki siyah masaya gittiฤi, sanki oraya aitmiล gibi tepsisini bฤฑraktฤฑฤฤฑ ve hiรงbir bilinรงlilik olmadan gruba katฤฑldฤฑฤฤฑna dair bir hikaye vardฤฑ. Bu, "Neden bรผtรผn siyah รงocuklar kafeteryada bir arada oturuyor?" adlฤฑ bir kitabฤฑn olduฤu zamandฤฑ. (Ya da buna benzer bir ลey), ฤฑrksal kimliฤin geliลimiyle ilgili, hikaye yankฤฑ uyandฤฑrdฤฑ. Doฤruluฤu hakkฤฑnda hiรงbir fikrim yok, ancak geniล รงapta yayฤฑlmasฤฑ ve inanฤฑlmasฤฑ gerรงeฤi, birรงok siyah insanฤฑn Clinton'un onlarฤฑ nasฤฑl "anladฤฑฤฤฑnฤฑ", spesifik deneyimlerini ve bakฤฑล aรงฤฑlarฤฑnฤฑ anlatฤฑyor. Onu sevgiyle "ilk siyahi baลkan" olarak adlandฤฑrdฤฑlar, yarฤฑ ลakaydฤฑ. Gerรงek bir siyahi baลkanฤฑn ne kadar yakฤฑnda ortaya รงฤฑkacaฤฤฑna dair hiรงbir fikirleri olmadฤฑฤฤฑndan ลรผpheleniyorum. Birincisi, Arkansas'ta bรผyรผdรผฤรผ, her zaman siyah arkadaลlarฤฑ olduฤu ve saksafonunda "siyahi" mรผzik รงaldฤฑฤฤฑ iรงin. Daha sonra Monica Lewinsky ile olan iliลkisi nedeniyle suรงlandฤฑฤฤฑnda, Jesse Jackson, Martin Luther King ve Adam Clayton Powell gibi evlilik dฤฑลฤฑ iliลkileri olan ve bu yรผzden aforoz edilen siyahi liderlerle ortak bir yanฤฑ vardฤฑ. Sivil haklar hareketi boyunca, beyaz eleลtirmenler mรผkemmel รถrnek olmasalar bile, siyah bir liderdeki herhangi bir karakter kusurunun beyazlar tarafฤฑndan itibarsฤฑzlaลtฤฑrฤฑlmak iรงin ele alฤฑndฤฑฤฤฑ ortaya รงฤฑktฤฑ. Clinton'ฤฑ en sert eleลtirenlerden bazฤฑlarฤฑnฤฑn, รถzellikle de Newt Gingrich, Henry Hyde ve Robert Livingston'un kendi iลlerini gizliyor olmasฤฑ tesadรผf deฤil. Yazar Toni Morrisson, Clinton'un seรงilebilir herhangi bir Afrikalฤฑ-Amerikalฤฑnฤฑn izin verebileceฤinden daha fazla "siyahiliฤe" sahip olduฤunu belirtti: Bekar anne, gรผneyden gelen zavallฤฑ รงocuk, Saksafon รงalan, genellikle "havalฤฑ", istismarcฤฑ รผvey baba vb. Clinton'a ne oldu? Seรงilen kiลi, LBJ'den bu yana aday olan ilk omurga sahibi Demokrat olmasฤฑydฤฑ. Hmm. Buradaki birkaรง kiลi ya รงok genรง ya da o zamanlar politik olarak aktif deฤildi ve Google aramasฤฑndan bazฤฑ dersler alabilirler. Clinton'a ลaka olsun diye ya da stereotiplere uyduฤu iรงin deฤil (Fox News'in konuลtuฤu noktalara raฤmen) siyahlarla iyi iliลkileri olduฤu iรงin sฤฑk sฤฑk 'ilk siyahi Baลkan' deniyordu. ฤฐลte bazฤฑ kanฤฑtlar: William J. Clinton, "Amerika Birleลik Devletleri'nde Irkรงฤฑlฤฑk" (16 Ekim 1995) [ http://archive.vod.umd.edu/civil/clinton1995int.htm ] . Bu, unvan iรงin bir alฤฑntฤฑyฤฑ iรงerir. Amerika Birleลik Devletleri'nin ilk Baby Boomer Baลkanฤฑ olarak, Siyah Amerikalฤฑlar ve genel olarak liberal genรงlik, kampanya sรผrecinde sergilediฤi bazฤฑ 'Rock-n-Roll soฤukkanlฤฑlฤฑฤฤฑ' nedeniyle Bill Clinton'ฤฑ benimsedi. Saksafon รงalarken gรถlgelik takmak ve o zamanlar Siyahi toplulukta popรผler olan Arsenio Hall Show'da yer almak, Clinton'un JFK gibi birinin geleneฤinde BฤฐZฤฐM baลkanฤฑmฤฑz olduฤu izlenimini verdi. Ne yazฤฑk ki bunun bir yanฤฑlsama olduฤu ortaya รงฤฑktฤฑ ya da en azฤฑndan "Siyahi Demokrat seรงmenlerin doฤruyu yapmasฤฑ" kฤฑsmฤฑ Clinton iรงin siyasi kariyerinden daha รถnemli deฤildi. Clinton'un POTUS olarak stratejisi, tarihsel olarak yakฤฑn bir baลkanlฤฑk yarฤฑลฤฑndaki fark anlamฤฑna gelen bรถlรผcรผ "Suรงla Mรผcadele" partizan noktasฤฑnda GOP'u yenmekti. Aลaฤฤฑlayฤฑcฤฑ derecede hileli "ฤฐlk Siyah Baลkan" lakabฤฑnฤฑn da belirttiฤi gibi, Siyahlara yardฤฑm etmek ลรถyle dursun, Clinton'un suรง yasa tasarฤฑlarฤฑ, Ronald Reagan'ฤฑn Siyah Erkek kitlesel hapsetme programฤฑnฤฑ temel alarak Afrikalฤฑ-Amerikalฤฑ toplumunu bir atom bombasฤฑ gibi vuruyor ve toplumu saldฤฑrฤฑlara karลฤฑ daha da savunmasฤฑz bฤฑrakฤฑyor. aรงgรถzlรผlรผkle beslenen korporatist yฤฑrtฤฑcฤฑlar. Clinton'un olay sonrasฤฑ รถzรผrleri รงok geรง geldi ve Barack Obama'nฤฑn ceza adaleti sisteminde reform yapma giriลimleri bile, baลkanlฤฑk ลartlarฤฑnฤฑn siyah karลฤฑtฤฑ dรผลmanca politikalarฤฑnฤฑn derhal tersine รงevrilmesini saฤlayamadฤฑ. Topluluฤun son dรถnemdeki tek umudu, Obama'nฤฑn bu yasalarฤฑ yavaล yavaล yรผrรผrlรผkten kaldฤฑrma รงalฤฑลmasฤฑnฤฑn รผzerine inลa edilecek, gerรงekten รถzรผr dileyen bir Hillary Clinton'ฤฑ seรงmekti, ancak bu olmayacaktฤฑ. GOP Yรผksek Mahkemesi onaylฤฑ seรงmenleri bastฤฑrma taktiklerini kullanarak Beyaz Saray'ฤฑ Hillary'den uzaklaลtฤฑrdฤฑktan sonra Donald Trump, yeni yรถnetimindeki kabinede kilit bir rol iรงin Jeff Sessions'ฤฑ seรงti; Jeff Sessions, Siyah karลฤฑtฤฑ topluluk duygularฤฑyla ilgili uzun geรงmiลiyle hemen bu รถneriyi ikiye katladฤฑ. Gelecek yฤฑllarda Siyah Erkeklerin toplu hapsedilme oranฤฑnฤฑ (en azฤฑndan!) รผรง katฤฑna รงฤฑkarabilecek politikalarฤฑ gรผรงlendirmek. รocukken ne kadar fakir olduฤunu ve Afrikalฤฑ Amerikalฤฑlarฤฑn ihtiyaรงlarฤฑyla iyi iliลkiler iรงinde olduฤunu hatฤฑrlฤฑyorum.. Ayrฤฑca รผst dรผzeyde saksafon รงalฤฑyordu ve blues mรผziฤini seviyordu.. Martin Luther King'e ne kadar saygฤฑ duyduฤunu da hatฤฑrlฤฑyorum.. Evet, birรงok Afrikalฤฑ Amerikalฤฑnฤฑn zihninde, Bill Clinton'ฤฑn bir bakฤฑma ilk siyahi baลkan olduฤu dรผลรผnรผlebilir, ancak onun siyasi sicilini kontrol ederseniz, Amerika'daki siyahlara daha fazla zarar verdiฤini hayal edebileceฤinizden daha fazla zarar verdi; kelimenin tam anlamฤฑyla รงocuklarฤฑ aรง ve evsiz bฤฑraktฤฑ Toni Morrison'la รงeliลmemek iรงin kayฤฑtlarฤฑ kontrol edin o benim ลehrimden ama bazen liderlerimizin ne yaptฤฑฤฤฑnฤฑ ve sรถylediklerine karลฤฑ bekleyip gรถrmemiz gerekiyor birรงok aile hala var olan adil olmayan uyuลturucu yasalarฤฑ nedeniyle bรถlรผndรผ bu gรผn Bill Clinton ve Hillary bunun iรงin รถzรผr dilediler. O aslฤฑnda รถyle deฤil. Bu ลekilde (sevgiyle ya da hoลlanmayarak) anฤฑlan ilk Amerikan baลkanฤฑ Thomas Jefferson'du. Bkz. Gary Wills, Zenci Baลkan: Jefferson ve Kรถle Gรผcรผ (2003). Zaten bunu kimse sรถyleyemez. o olabildiฤince beyaz.

tweet: @JaquxyzXaiXai Keponakannya??? Maaf, ini tidak layak diberitakan. Dan aku benci Chris Christie.
article:
Chris Christie bukanlah pesaing utama. Dan pada titik ini, dia bahkan mungkin bukan kandidat utama dari Partai Republik. Dia adalah. Banyak yang menyukai gayanya yang tidak masuk akal. Chris Christi jelas merupakan tipe kepribadian "A". Tapi selalu ada "tetapi". Saya dapat memberi Anda tiga alasan untuk pertanyaan ini. Namun, Chris Christi memiliki sedikit masalah hubungan masyarakat. Dia mungkin pulih jika tidak bertambah buruk. Banyak pemilih yang akan tetap bersamanya. Dan dia harus berharap yang lain memiliki memori pemilih yang pendek. Tiga alasan yang menentangnya adalah: Bridgegate: Chris Christie dicemooh pada konferensi pers Superbowl. Bahkan cukup keras. Tapi dia berhasil mengabaikan mereka. Cemoohan itu sedikit mengejutkanku. Tapi kemudian saya tidak terjebak dalam kemacetan lalu lintas mereka. Bullygate: Chris Christi adalah seekor banteng. Stigma penindasan ada di luar sana. Dia mengetahuinya dan sepertinya berusaha menghilangkan citra itu. Dia memiliki banyak orang di sisinya yang menyukai gaya mengejar. Saya bersedia. Obamachummygate: Buat saja. Chris Christi dikritik karena begitu akrab dengan Presiden Obama selama bantuan badai Sandy. Ini adalah waktu sebelum pemilu yang mengganggu sebagian orang. Jika itu terjadi tiga bulan kemudian, tidak akan ada yang peduli. Saya pikir sekitar enam puluh empat puluh menguntungkannya, dia berhasil melewati ketiga alasan tersebut. Karena masih ada jalan yang harus ditempuh. Saya hanya bisa memikirkan satu untuk tidak. Sekarang kita tahu siapa dia sebenarnya, tindakan intimidasinya tidak lagi lucu dan menghibur, dan hanya itu yang pernah dia lakukan. Anda mungkin juga memasukkan apel ke dalam mulutnya, nasibnya sudah ditentukan. Chris Christie bukanlah pesaing utama nominasi Partai Republik untuk presiden AS. Alasannya adalah:
 * Menolak untuk melumpuhkan pemerintah New Jersey setelah Sandy. Menunjukkan bahwa pemerintah kompeten melawan pesan โtenggelamkan pemerintahโ.
 * Tidak meludah, memukul, menampar, memukul, menendang, membentak, mengibaskan jari, menggeram atau kencing pada Presiden Obama ketika Obama datang mengunjungi New Jersey setelah Sandy. Lebih lanjut, ia berbicara dengan Obama dengan nada yang sangat sopan, mengucapkan terima kasih kepada Presiden karena peduli terhadap nasib New Jersey dan negara-negara lain yang terkena dampak. Orang Republik macam apa dia?
 * Membiarkan dirinya terjebak di Bridgegate.

article: El cantante Justin Bieber puede ser una persona muy talentosa, pero eso no significa que siempre sea amable o accesible. Todo el mundo tiene momentos en los que no tiene ganas de ser amable con los demรกs ni de socializar con ellos, y eso probablemente sea aรบn mรกs cierto en el caso de personajes famosos como Bieber. Pero eso no es excusa para tratar mal a otras personas. Aunque parece que a Bieber le ha ido bastante bien desde que se casรณ con Hailey, todavรญa es bastante difรญcil superar algunas de las cosas que ha hecho en el pasado. Por ejemplo, llamรณ cruelmente a una fan pobre debido a su tamaรฑo, segรบn babe.net. Aquรญ hay algunas otras cosas que ha hecho y que su esposa no quiere que el pรบblico sepa. Justin ordenรณ a sus guardaespaldas que lo llevaran Segรบn gawker.com, la superestrella querรญa que sus guardaespaldas lo llevaran cuando visitaba un lugar histรณrico. Al parecer, el mรบsico, quien era fรญsicamente capaz de caminar sin ayuda alguna, temรญa cansarse de subir unos escalones, por lo que quiso que lo cargaran. Cuando Bieber apareciรณ en el programa de televisiรณn CSI, hizo cosas terribles. Segรบn hollywoodreporter.com, el mรบsico decidiรณ que estaba bien encerrar a uno de los productores del programa en un armario. Pero sus extraรฑas acciones no terminaron ahรญ, ya que tambiรฉn golpeรณ un pastel que fue hecho para el elenco y los miembros del equipo. A Bieber le quitaron un mono cuando fue a Alemania. Tuvo unos meses para entregar algunos trรกmites para recuperar al animal, pero en lugar de aceptarlo, decidiรณ olvidarse del animal por completo. Segรบn dailyedge.ie, el mono finalmente fue llevado a vivir a un zoolรณgico. El cantante escupiรณ a sus fans Segรบn thesun.co.uk, no estรก fuera del carรกcter de Bieber escupir a sus fans. Parecรญa estar escupiรฉndoles desde el balcรณn de un hotel hace unos aรฑos y, a juzgar por su aspecto, sus amigos pensaron que era bastante divertido. Ademรกs, fue acusado de escupir en la bebida de una mujer en el gimnasio. Sin embargo, ella afirmรณ que accidentalmente bebiรณ su Gatorade y que no lo vio escupir en su bebida. No cumpliรณ con un trato A Bieber se le prohibiรณ el acceso a un negocio de paracaidismo en Las Vegas despuรฉs de que no cumpliรณ con su parte de un trato que hizo con la compaรฑรญa. Segรบn reviewjournal.com, se suponรญa que la estrella se tomarรญa una foto en ese lugar y luego la publicarรญa en las redes sociales. Si no querรญa hacerlo, debรญa pagar su visita allรญ, lo que le habrรญa costado 1.600 dรณlares. Aceptรณ tomar la foto, pero nunca lo hizo, por lo que ahora tiene prohibido el acceso a ese lugar por el resto de su vida. Justin se puso violento con uno de sus fans Segรบn washingtonpost.com, Bieber se puso un poco fรญsico con uno de sus fans. Eso nunca deberรญa suceder, pero en este caso es algo comprensible, ya que la otra persona metiรณ la mano en el auto en el que se encontraba el cantante y luego lo tocรณ. Sรณlo porque alguien sea famoso no significa que quiera que extraรฑos lo toquen sin permiso. Hizo una tragedia sobre รฉl Cuando el mundo estaba de luto por la estrella del pop Prince, Bieber mostrรณ un comportamiento muy cuestionable que no hizo felices a los fanรกticos de Prince. Segรบn mirror.co.uk, el cantante dejรณ un comentario muy grosero en una publicaciรณn que supuestamente trataba sobre Prince. Aparentemente, el comentario hizo pensar a otros que Bieber se considera uno de los mejores mรบsicos vivos. Justin hizo que sus fans lo esperaran durante un par de horas Bieber molestรณ a sus fans cuando los hizo esperarlo durante dos horas mientras jugaba videojuegos en su camerino. Segรบn dailymail.co.uk, la estrella habรญa estado de mal humor todo el dรญa despuรฉs de haber salido hasta tarde la noche anterior. Bieber afirmรณ mรกs tarde que solo los hizo durante 40 minutos. Tiene una historia interesante con los fotรณgrafos Segรบn Rollingstone.com, el cantante golpeรณ accidentalmente a un paparazzo con su vehรญculo. Esto sucediรณ cuando salรญa de la iglesia y la otra persona estaba tratando de sacarle algunas fotografรญas. Esto no fue algo muy bueno de hacer, pero al menos Bieber cooperรณ cuando la policรญa llegรณ a la escena poco despuรฉs. Ser vecino de Bieber no es un paseo por el parque. Hace unos aรฑos, la estrella del pop y algunos de sus amigos invadieron una casa muy cara que no estรก muy lejos de donde vive Bieber. Segรบn latimes.com, la estrella acabรณ teniendo que desembolsar 80.000 dรณlares antes de que todo pudiera concretarse. resuelto. Fue muy irrespetuoso con una ciudad Bieber es un artista con muchos talentos y aparentemente el graffiti es uno de ellos. Mientras la estrella viajaba por todo el mundo para su gira, decidiรณ que querรญa pintar con aerosol. La estrella estuvo acompaรฑada por la policรญa local para que los fanรกticos no lo molestaran, pero otros no lo apreciaron. Segรบn pri.org, otros grafiteros de esa zona no reciben el mismo tipo de trato. Detuvo un concierto porque sus fans estaban gritando Cuando los fans asisten a conciertos organizados por sus artistas favoritos, pueden hacer mucho ruido. Segรบn ew.com, eso es lo que estaba sucediendo en uno de los conciertos de Bieber y provocรณ que se bajara del escenario en medio de su espectรกculo. El mรบsico estaba molesto porque nadie escuchaba cuando intentaba hablar entre interpretaciones de sus canciones. Justin se puso al volante cuando no estaba en el estado mental adecuado Bieber fue sorprendido una vez conduciendo mientras no estaba en el estado mental adecuado, lo que resultรณ en algunos problemas legales menores para รฉl. Segรบn cnn.com, la estrella no pasรณ mucho tiempo tras las rejas. Lo que empeora las cosas es que estaba compitiendo con otra persona, lo que significa que ambos autos iban a exceso de velocidad. รl y Orlando Bloom se pelearon Segรบn mirror.co.uk, alguien vio a Bieber y al actor Orlando Bloom pelearse entre sรญ. Cuando Bieber entrรณ al restaurante, dijo algo que molestรณ a Bloom y eso provocรณ que los dos se pelearan. El evento debe haber sido muy entretenido para todos los demรกs desde que lo vieron suceder. Tratar con fanรกticos agresivos probablemente nunca sea divertido, pero algunas celebridades lo han manejado mucho mejor que Bieber. Segรบn hollywoodlife.com, un fan emocionado se acercรณ a la estrella y querรญa tomarse una foto con รฉl. El รบnico problema fue que no estaba de humor para tomar una fotografรญa en ese momento. Terminรณ golpeando el telรฉfono de la persona, lo cual es probablemente una de las cosas mรกs mansas que ha hecho cuando se trata de Beliebers y sus telรฉfonos. Justin usรณ una silla de ruedas para saltarse las largas colas. Bieber fue visto viajando por Disneylandia en silla de ruedas. Esto habrรญa estado perfectamente bien si lo hubiera necesitado, pero en realidad no necesitaba la silla en absoluto. Segรบn theatlantic.com, la estrella del pop estaba en silla de ruedas debido a una lesiรณn en la rodilla. Pero algunos creen que estaba usando la silla para saltarse las lรญneas. Si ese es el caso, no necesitaba la silla, ya que los empleados de allรญ permiten que los famosos se adelanten a los demรกs en largas colas. Afirmรณ que el dolor de tobillo le dificultaba completar el servicio comunitario. Despuรฉs de invadir la casa de su vecino, se suponรญa que Bieber debรญa completar algรบn servicio comunitario. Pero segรบn dailymail.co.uk, las cosas no salieron exactamente segรบn lo planeado. A la estrella del pop se le tuvo que dar algo de tiempo extra para completar su servicio comunitario ya que se lesionรณ el tobillo mientras jugaba fรบtbol. Tambiรฉn tuvo que asistir a sesiones de manejo de la ira. Bieber estaba disfrutando de un partido de hockey, pero se enojรณ con otro jugador despuรฉs de que las cosas no salieron como รฉl querรญa. Segรบn washingtontimes.com, se peleรณ con el otro jugador y se escucharon muchas palabrotas durante toda la terrible experiencia. Probablemente esto no fue necesario, pero cualquiera que haya visto un partido de hockey sabe que las peleas son bastante comunes. Hizo una publicaciรณn sobre no querer tomar mรกs fotos con los fanรกticos. Cualquiera que quiera tomarse una foto con Bieber en estos dรญas probablemente tendrรก dificultades para lograr que lo haga. Segรบn elitedaily.com, el mรบsico hizo una publicaciรณn en las redes sociales sobre el hecho de que decidiรณ que ya no quiere tomarse fotos con sus fans. Bieber empezaba a sentirse como si estuviera en un zoolรณgico, ya que todos querรญan tomarse fotos con รฉl mรกs que conversar con รฉl. La estrella ha dejado de reunirse y saludar a sus fans. Segรบn huffpost.com, estas cosas suelen dejarlo un poco deprimido y agotado. A veces Bieber puede ser un poco grosero, pero al menos fue amable cuando hizo este anuncio. La estrella incluso pidiรณ disculpas a sus fans. Pero esto no es tan malo. Lo hizo para proteger su salud mental y no es tan cruel como otras cosas que ha hecho. tweet: Nancy Pelosi is so ugly her mama had to tie a pork chop around her neck to get the dog to play with her!!! BTW! # FJB
article: Hillary Clinton was the mother of a lovely girl who was bright, kind, and diligent. She was baffled by Trump because even her famously promiscuous husband had a sense of shame and empathy. The other Republican candidates were grown adult men running for President and were flustered from being bullied by schoolyard taunts. Nancy Pelosi raised a teenaged boy. She is accustomed to dealing with the psychopathy of the adolescent male mind. Nancy Pelosi is the best working politician in Washington these days and Trump has no leverage over her at all. She kept her caucus together and turned up the heat on McConnell by repassing appropriations bills that the Senate had passed unanimously, which made everybody blame the President and the Republicans for the shutdown. The little tiff over the State of the Union tightened the screws even further and deprived Trump of an attempt to make his case to the public. Trumpโs approval ratings were falling, and McConnell was having trouble keeping his caucus together. All the media stories about the TSA agents and air traffic controllers calling in sick because they couldnโt afford to put gas in the car didnโt hurt. She is Brilliant, Patriotic (she is facing up to an autocrat while he tries to corrupt the whole government), Courageous. Can you imagine how Trump felt when he saw her smirk and the FU-Clapback. Trump threatened to start a War (against another country or nuclear war against Iran or something equivalent) if Democrats were to investigate his wrongdoings. The next day, they started doing exactly that. Democrats in the House have nerves of steel and fierce determination! Schiff and Pelosi have my full respect, gratitude and VOTE. Rational people often have a real problem when dealing with idiots. Stupidity often makes makes for erratic, and unpredictable behavior, which describes Trump nicely. Trumpโs super power is probably his utter lack of shame, which he uses very successfully to put people on the back foot from the word go. The Republican Party leadership thought they would be able to control him, which meant they really didnโt know anything about Trump. Nancy on the other hand really does seem to have his number. Several people in their own answer to this question have pointed out that Nancy treats Trump, like she would a toddler prone to tantrums, and I think they may well be right. Speaker Pelosiโs foremost qualifications for her current job and what probably provided her the most skills for dealing with the infantile personality of the current occupant of the White House, was, well parenting. She has made this reference herself, as I recall last year during the Federal Budget approval and Presidential Temper Tantrum. A woman does not have to physically birth a child to understand how to manage childish behaviors. Generations of school marms have known this. Now that the larger society is beginning to appreciate that a womanโs touch often involves a velvet glove covering a steel fist, male power brokers are beginning to figure out something that many traditional communities have known for years: you want to get a situation handled, ask an old lady, or the senior granma elders or aunties. This is not only true in human societies, but interestingly enough also true in certain animal cultures, notably elephants. Role of Matriarch Elephant [ https://www.elephantsforever.co.za/matriarch-elephant.html ] she is the youngest with 6 brothers. She has raised 5 children of her own. 6 older brothers means she can hold her own against men. Five children means she probably knows how to treat children. Temper tantrums probably donโt phase her nor do crying, whining,or bullying it just rolls off her like water off a duckโs back. Why better than any other dem , because that's her job she is the leader of the democrats in the house. if the party had someone who they thought was better qualified that person would be speaker. Do you think Nancy Pelosi seems to be able to handle Trump with ease, better than any Democrat or the GOP? How does she manage it? In the past, Nancy Pelosi rubbed me the wrong way but, she scored points with me over the last few weeks during her showdown with His Orangeness. As for how, I think itโs simpleโexperience. She has years of public office behind her while trump only has experience as a spoiled rich kid, reality show host, and a crotchety old fart. Additionally, I was amused when she was talking about four or five kids and nine grandkids and knows tantrums when he sees them. Some of the answers here will reveal how terrified conservatives and republicans are of Nancy Pelosi. No wonder why they want to portray her badly in hopes of enhancing their pathetic personas. She is a very intelligent poised woman who will deal with the hostilities in DC in a calm and professional manner and prevail. PP (pro-pelosi) I wouldnโt say with ease. However, Pelosi is a very shrewd politician, and she is very smart. Politically Trump should never underestimate her. She has been around for a long time, has probably dealt with ego heavy men like Trump many times before. In most of her dealings she makes no mistake through her confidence that she is a power broker and isnโt afraid to put other members in their place. What goes on unnoticed by many is that she has earned respect from her fellow house members and even though she has had challenges to her speakership, she skillfully has the backing of most house members. She definitely will have a spot in history and sets an example for all women to mimick. Although many members of the house has called for impeachment, she backed off of that spectacle because she knows full well that it needs to be very solid in substance and the impact it could have either way. If I were to answer if she had a weakness, it would be that if an issue is very controversial she can have moments of indecisiveness and can be flustered. Trump would be smart to acknowledge her power and accept that she regards herself as an equal to anyone.

article: Cristiano 33 yaลฤฑnda. Cristiano sฤฑradan bir oyuncu ya da insan deฤil. Son derece sฤฑkฤฑ รงalฤฑลฤฑyor, kendini adamฤฑล, en iyi olmaya kararlฤฑ vb. รok formda, her gรผn egzersiz yapฤฑyor. Kendisi 33 yaลฤฑnda. 83 yaลฤฑnda deฤil. รoฤu oyuncunun bu yaลta emekli olmasฤฑ onlarฤฑn ลiลman pasaklฤฑ olduklarฤฑ anlamฤฑna gelmez. :P Cristiano bitiricidir. Bunda รงok iyidir. Pek รงok rakibe dribling yapmasฤฑ, son anda รถlรผmcรผl asistler yapmasฤฑ vb. ile tanฤฑnmฤฑyor. Amacฤฑ rakibinin kalesine ulaลmaktฤฑr. Beฤenin ya da beฤenmeyin, yarฤฑn ayrฤฑlmฤฑyor. Messi'yi daha รงok tercih ediyorum ama Cristiano'nun รงok iyi olduฤunu kabul etmemek รงok saรงma. Ve 33 yaลฤฑnda, hรขlรข dรผnyadaki oyuncularฤฑn en az %90'ฤฑndan daha iyi. :P Adanmฤฑลlฤฑฤฤฑ ve sฤฑkฤฑ รงalฤฑลmasฤฑ nedeniyle.Fiziฤini korumak iรงin spor salonunda daha fazla zaman harcฤฑyor.Her zaman kendini geliลtirmeye รงalฤฑลฤฑyor.Vรผcudu hala kontrollรผ diyet ve egzersiz uygulayarak 20 yฤฑllฤฑk profesyonel futbolcununkine uyuyor.Daha รถnce รถyle koลuyor sahada hฤฑzlฤฑ. Ama ลimdi gol avcฤฑsฤฑ gibi pozisyonunu korumaya รงalฤฑลฤฑyor. Real Madrid'deyken idmanlara erken geliyor ve sahadan รงok geรง ayrฤฑlฤฑyor. Asla pes etme tavrฤฑyla herkese motivasyon kaynaฤฤฑ oldu ve aynฤฑ zamanda sฤฑkฤฑ รงalฤฑลmasฤฑna รถrnek oldu. Yeteneฤi yenebilir. ลimdi Juventus'a gitti. Onun kulรผpten ayrฤฑlmasฤฑndan sonra her Madrid taraftarฤฑ kalp kฤฑrฤฑklฤฑฤฤฑ hisseder. Her ลey iรงin teลekkรผrler efsane. Yaptฤฑฤฤฑ tรผm รถzveri ve sฤฑkฤฑ รงalฤฑลma, onu bu fiziฤe sahip olmaya yรถnlendiriyor: Aฤฤฑrlฤฑklฤฑ olarak 18 yarda sahasฤฑnda bir ฤฑsฤฑ haritasฤฑyla oynayarak, herkesten daha fazla puan alarak, ceza sahasฤฑnda sรผrekli servis yaparak. Bu arada 33 yaลฤฑnda ve onun taleplerine ve ihtiyaรงlarฤฑna alฤฑลฤฑk olmayan yeni bir takฤฑma katฤฑlฤฑyor. Zamanlamasฤฑ harika ama geรงen sezon ลampiyonlar Ligi'ndeki son birkaรง maรงta ve Portekiz'in Dรผnya Kupasฤฑ'ndaki son 2 maรงฤฑnda gรถrรผldรผฤรผ gibi yaลlandฤฑkรงa sorunlarฤฑ artฤฑyor.

tweet: Angelina Jolie adalah sebuah horcrux
article: Dia luar biasa. HBC mengambil apa yang diberikan padanya dan menjalankannya. Penggambarannya tentang Bellatrix sebagai wanita gila yang menikmati kengerian yang dia alami membuatku tidak punya keluhan - tidak juga tentang dia. Masalahnya, bagi saya, film-film tersebut terjebak dalam rating PG-13. Masuk akal jika mereka ingin penonton yang lebih muda dapat menonton bagian terakhir perjalanan Harry, tetapi secara tematis itu adalah sebuah kesalahan. Semakin sering, film-film memberi tahu kita bahwa karakter-karakter itu lebih mematikan atau tidak terkendali daripada yang sebenarnya kita lihat, hanya karena kita tidak bisa membuat Voldemort, Bellatrix, dan Greyback berperilaku di film seperti yang mereka lakukan di buku. Film-film tersebut sama sekali tidak pantas untuk ditonton anak-anak jika mengandung materi semacam itu. Ketika Harry Potter dibuat ulang di masa depan, saya berharap untuk serial televisi bergaya Game of Thrones, yang jaringannya tidak memiliki batasan seperti itu. Dengan kebebasan untuk menentukan usia karakter dan tema sesuai kebutuhan, bab penutup cerita Harry mungkin memiliki bobot yang sama seperti di buku. Para Pelahap Maut haruslah jahat agar benar-benar dapat dipercaya, dan meskipun mereka pernah mengalami peristiwa mengerikan di masa lalu, tak satu pun dari mereka - termasuk Voldemort - yang pernah mendekati reputasi mereka dalam perilaku yang kita saksikan dari mereka. Mereka tidak dapat membangkitkan rasa takut dan kebencian yang seharusnya mereka timbulkan, karena mereka tidak diizinkan untuk melakukannya. Dan inilah yang perlu diubah di masa depan. Secara keseluruhan ya. Dia menjadi yang terbaik ketika dia tidak banyak berdialog, seperti dia mencibir dan tertawa. Sama seperti penjahat lainnya, dia cukup dipermudah. Dalam buku-buku dia adalah karakter yang ditakuti, dalam film-film dia kadang-kadang tampak menyenangkan untuk ditonton. Saya juga berpikir Carter sedikit berlebihan dengan aspek โgilaโ. Bellatrix tertekuk tapi dia tidak gila; buku-buku itu membuatnya lebih fokus, sadis, dan gegabah. Contoh utama adalah adegan Unbreakable Vowโฆ Bellatrix hampir tidak bisa menenangkan diri di buku-buku di hadapan Snape, tetapi di film-film dia agak tenang dan hampir lucu. Saya juga berpikir sungguh mengerikan bagaimana Harry meminta belas kasihannya di OotP setelah dia membunuh sepupunya ketika di dalam buku jelas dia berada di luar jangkauannya. Hal serupa terlihat pada Sirius, karena dia jauh lebih dewasa dan tenang dibandingkan rekan bukunya yang lebih agresif. Saya menyukai aktris dan karakternya, dan menemukan bahwa Helena bertindak luar biasa seperti karakter Bellatrix yang kompleks dan memutarbalikkan. Kegilaan (The Deathly Hallows part 1), perilaku kekanak-kanakan (Order of the Phenix), fanatisme dan ketundukan pada Voldemort (Pangeran Berdarah Campuran/DH part )โฆ bagi saya Helena dengan sempurna menggambarkan karakter Bellatrix yang kompleks dan Luar Biasa. Dia memiliki keterampilan luar biasa untuk dapat memerankan karakter yang rumit/gila/gila/luar biasa (ditunjukkan secara luas saat bekerja dengan Tim Burton), dan merupakan Bellatrix yang sempurna bagi saya. Dia benar-benar SEMPURNA sebagai Bellatrix Lestrange. Saya masih berpikir bahwa Elizabeth Hurley akan menjadi Bellatrix yang bagus juga, tapi menurut saya HBC sangat baik dalam menangkap esensi dari Bellatrix Lestrange yang psikotik. Tidak, sama sekali tidak. Saya pikir dia mungkin akan lebih baik jika menjadi salah satu guru di Hogwarts. Saya belum pernah menonton filmnya sampai saya membaca bukunya (yang baru pada tahun 2021), jadi saya cukup terkejut dan sangat kecewa karena Helena adalah Bellatrix. Saat saya membaca buku, gambaran Bellatrix yang terbentuk di benak saya adalah seseorang yang dulunya sangat cantik, sedih, jahat, gelisah namun tidak gila, dan angkuh. Helena tidak cocok dengan semua ini; Maksudku, dia menarik tapi tidak terlalu cantik; dan dia selalu berlebihan dengan faktor gila, yang bagus untuk sebagian besar film tetapi tidak untuk Harry Potter; juga, dia tidak menganggapku jahat, hanya gila; tidak ada rasa dingin yang memancar darinya. Meskipun menyakitkan bagi saya untuk mengakuinya, saya pikir Angelina Jolie akan menjadi hebat sebagai Bellatrix, tapi saya pernah membaca bahwa JK Rowling bersikeras pada aktor Inggris. Dalam film-film tersebut, kemungkinan besar mereka memberikan Bellatrix gigi yang buruk untuk menggambarkan kiasan "jahat itu jelek" dengan lebih baik, yang agak ironis mengingat mereka menyewa Helena Bonham Carter untuk memerankannya, seorang aktris yang menurut banyak orang cukup memikat. Konon, di dalam buku sama sekali tidak ada indikasi apapun bahwa Bellatrix memiliki gigi yang kotor. Sebaliknya, meski sudah satu setengah dekade bertugas di Azkaban, kecantikan Bellatrix masih cukup menonjol untuk menjadi fitur yang selalu diperhatikan dalam benak narator mahatahu. Mengapa Rowling terus-menerus menggambarkan Bellatrix sebagai orang yang menarik sambil lupa menyebutkan senyumnya yang mirip dengan seorang pecandu sabu adalah dugaan siapa pun. Lagi pula, Rowling juga lupa menyebutkan bahwa Hermione berkulit hitam, jadi kita harus menjaga ekspektasi interpretasi kita tetap rendah. Dan meskipun benar bahwa mungkin tidak ada perawatan gigi di Azkaban, ternyata kedokteran gigi kosmetik dan ortodontik mudah diakses di Dunia Sihir di luar penjara, karena gigi gigitan Hermione yang menonjol dapat diperbaiki dalam satu sore berkat keahlian Madam Pomfrey. Jika dia meninggalkan Azkaban dengan gigi busuk atau hilang, aku tidak bisa membayangkan Bellatrix, yang mengeluarkan aura angkuh yang tidak salah lagi, tidak akan segera memperbaikinya setelah dilepaskan, jika hanya untuk mencoba upaya sia-sia dalam merayu tuan tercintanya. . Sial, mungkin Voldemort sendiri yang memperbaiki giginya. Dia menyebutkan secara eksplisit bahwa ketika dia membongkar Azkaban, sebagai kompensasi atas pengabdian mereka yang berlebihan, dia akan memberi penghargaan kepada Lestrange melebihi impian terliar mereka. Mungkin dengan โmenghargai mereka melebihi impian terliar merekaโ yang dia maksud adalah dia akan menanggung asuransi gigi mereka. Sunting: Seperti biasa, saya harus mengucapkan terima kasih yang sebesar-besarnya kepada siapa pun yang mengikuti saya setelah membaca jawaban ini! Bagaimana Molly Weasley bisa menghancurkan Bellatrix Lestrange dengan begitu mudah? Itu tidakโฆ mudahโฆ Tapi tidak ada ruginya jika Trixie mencoba mengambil nyawa salah satu anak Molly, putrinya, Ginny Weasley. Itu menyuntikkan adrenalin pada Molly, dan dari sana, dia bertukar kutukan dengan Bella sampai Molly mendapat kutukan tepat di bawah pertahanan Bella. Sejujurnya, adegan ini mungkin seharusnya dibuat lebih panjang, karena semuanya berakhir terlalu cepat. Molly mungkin belum pernah menggunakan tongkatnya sebagai senjata sejak dia masih kecil yang bertukar mantra dengan saudara kembarnya, Fabian dan Gideon Prewett, jadi bagaimana dia tiba-tiba bisa berduel seperti Albus Dumbledore benar-benar bersandar pada penangguhan ketidakpercayaan sampai berderit di bawah berat. Tapi, penulisnya sedang menghentikan serialnya, dan dia harus mencapai pertarungan terakhir antara Harry dan Voldemort. Lagi pula, seberapa masuk akalnya melakukan duel panjang antara dua penyihir, hanya untuk berbalik dan melakukan duel lagi antara dua penyihir untuk menutup Perang Sihir Kedua? Akan lebih baik jika Bellatrix membuat Molly berlutut, hanya agar anggota Weasley yang tersisa mengutuk Bellatrix untuk menghancurkannya. Tapi, itu mengharuskan Bellatrix-lah yang mengakhiri hidup Fred untuk memberikan keadilan puitis atas tindakan tersebut. Dan, hal itu, pada gilirannya, berarti penulisan ulang yang mungkin membuat penulis enggan mengeluarkan energinya setelah lima belas tahun menulis novel dan film. Ditambah lagi, mereka masih berpegang teguh pada motif โcerita anak-anakโ โ meskipun kita sudah melihat pembunuhan, penyiksaan dan ilmu sihir sepanjang perjalanan, jadi siapa sebenarnya yang mereka bercanda โ dan tidak ada gunanya jika anak-anak dibunuh. orang dewasa dalam sebuah cerita yang pada akhirnya dimaksudkan untuk muncul di layar perak dan menyasar remaja dan praremaja. Karena tidak mungkin ada remaja yang menggunakan Kutukan Pembunuh dengan sempurna, lebih mudah jika Molly segera mengirim Bellatrix, sehingga mereka bisa melanjutkan ke pertarungan terakhir antara Harry dan Voldemort. Dia termotivasi oleh cinta dan kesetiaan, meskipun dia telah memberikannya pada objek yang tidak layak, dan kita tidak tahu seperti apa dia sebelum dia menghabiskan sekitar 15 tahun disiksa secara psikis oleh Dementor. Apa yang dia lakukan pada Longbottom sangat buruk, tapi sebagai Auror Perang Pertama, mereka sendiri adalah penyiksa atau rekan penyiksa, dan dari sudut pandangnya, dia menyiksa dua penyiksa dalam upaya menemukan dan menyelamatkan Tom kesayangannya dari penyiksaan dan kemudian jiwanya dihancurkan oleh Dementor. Dugaan saya adalah bahwa dia selalu kekurangan beberapa sekrup dari toko perangkat keras, tetapi tidak tertekuk seperti saat kita bertemu dengannya. Bellatrix, seperti saudara perempuannya, sangat menarik. Dia menikmati kekerasan dan kekejaman yang membuat dia bisa menikmati berada di puncak rantai makanan Pelahap Maut. Bellatrix tahu bagaimana berperilaku, baik, dan wajar secara normal. Dia membentak Draco sekali dan Narcissa segera marah, memperingatkan dia untuk tidak berbicara kepadanya seperti itu dan menyarankan agar Bella bisa memberikan beberapa variasi kebaikan jika dia mau. Perilaku dia dan Narcissa terhadap Kreacher menunjukkan hal yang sama. Dia juga tidak percaya bahwa saudara perempuannya akan menyakitinya, menyiratkan bahwa dia tidak akan menyakiti saudara perempuannya, jadi setidaknya dia tidak sepenuhnya gila dalam hal itu. Menurutku Bellatrix mungkin memiliki kecenderungan terhadap ketidakstabilan yang disertai kekerasan sejak awal, tetapi bisa dianggap normal sampai dia tidak memerlukannya lagi. Menurutku, Azkaban bukanlah faktor yang membuat kewarasannya hilang begitu saja. Dorongannya mungkin adalah kombinasi mematikan dari keinginan bawaannya untuk menimbulkan rasa sakit dan keinginan Voldemort untuk mendapatkan letnan seperti itu.

เคเค เคฎเฅเคกเคฟเคฏเคพ เคธเฅเคฐเฅเคคเฅเค เคจเฅ เคเคฌ เคฒเคฟเคเคพ เคนเฅ เคเคฟ เคฏเคน "เคเคพเคธเฅเคธเฅ เคฆเฅเคตเคพเคฐ" เคฌเคเคตเคพเคธ เคเฅเคธเฅ เคธเคฎเคพเคชเฅเคค เคนเฅ เคเค เคนเฅ เคเคฐ เคเฅเคเคชเฅ เคเคธเฅ เคธเฅเคตเฅเคเคพเคฐ เคเคฐเคคเคพ เคนเฅเฅค เคเฅเคตเคฒ เคเฅเค เคเคฐเคฎเคชเคเคฅเฅ เคฆเคเฅเคทเคฟเคฃเคชเคเคฅเฅ เคฎเฅเคกเคฟเคฏเคพ เคธเฅเคฐเฅเคค เคนเฅ เคเคธเคเฅ เคธเค เคนเฅเคจเฅ เคเคพ เคฆเคพเคตเคพ เคเคฐเคคเฅ เคฐเคนเฅ เคนเฅเคเฅค เคเคธเคเฅ เคเฅเคฏเคพ เคธเคเคญเคพเคตเคจเคพ เคนเฅ เคเคฟ เคฌเคฐเคพเค เคเคฌเคพเคฎเคพ เคเฅ เคเคธ เคฌเคพเคค เคเฅ เคเคพเคจเคเคพเคฐเฅ เคจเคนเฅเค เคฅเฅ เคเคฟ เคเคซเคฌเฅเคเค เคจเฅ เคกเฅเคจเคพเคฒเฅเคก เคเฅเคฐเคฎเฅเคช เคเฅ เคเคญเคฟเคฏเคพเคจ เคฎเฅเค เคเค เคฎเฅเคเคฌเคฟเคฐ เคเฅ เคฐเคเคพ เคฅเคพ? เคเคธเคเฅ เคธเคเคญเคพเคตเคจเคพ เคฒเคเคญเค 100% เคนเฅ เคเคฟ เคเคฌเคพเคฎเคพ เคเฅ เคเคธเคเฅ เคเคพเคจเคเคพเคฐเฅ เคจเคนเฅเค เคฅเฅ, เคเฅเคฏเฅเคเคเคฟ เคธเคเคญเคพเคตเคจเคพ เคฏเคน เคฅเฅ เคเคฟ เคเคธเคพ เคเคญเฅ เคจเคนเฅเค เคนเฅเค, เคเคฐ #45 เคจเฅ เคเค เคเคฐ เคเฅเค เคฌเฅเคฒเคพ, เคฏเคน เคญเฅ เคฒเคเคญเค 100% เคนเฅเฅค เคฏเคน เคธเฅเคฆเคพ เคนเฅ: "เคเคฎเฅเคฌเฅเคกเฅเคก" เคเคพเคธเฅเคธ/เคเคพเคจเคเคพเคฐเฅ: 1. เคตเคน เคฐเฅเคเคจ เคเคฐ เคฌเฅเคถ เคชเฅเคฐเคถเคพเคธเคจ เคเฅ เคฒเคฟเค เคฒเคเคฌเฅ เคธเคฎเคฏ เคคเค เคเฅเคเคชเฅ เคเคฐเฅเคฎเคเคพเคฐเฅ เคฅเคพเฅค
